subject: Soccer
Stadiums and Arenas
lead_paragraph: A decision by soccer’s rule-making body to standardize the size of fields for international games will most likely not prevent Giants Stadium and other existing facilities from being used as sites. The International Football Association Board voted Saturday to institute a rule that matches involving national teams must be played on fields 105 meters long by 68 meters wide (114.8 by 74.4 yards). If applied to Giants Stadium, the new provision might rule out a possible June 8 exhibition game between the United States and Argentina. A spokesman for FIFA, however, said that the rule was not intended to be “retroactive” and that “the unification of dimensions is for new stadiums.”.
